models_FPC module¶

The file contains models that will be used in the flow past cylinder. This file is only used to add the notes and generate the documentation. These models have been added to the ipynb files

@author: Fan Yang

class models_FPC.CNN_1(hidden_1)¶

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

The architecture of SFC-CAE is used in flow past cylinder. It consists of fully connected layers and convolutional layers. We use the space-filling-curve (SFC) to map the multi-dimensional space into the one-dimensional space representation.

Parameters

hidden_1 (int) – The number of the latent variable can be adjusted from 1 to any proper value

forward(x)¶

Send the data to the encoder and decoder in order to get the corresponding output

Parameters

x (tensor or numpy) – The input data to the autoencoder

Returns

  • encoded (tensor) – The output of the encoder in the space-filling curve convolutional autoencoder

  • decoded (tensor) – The output of the decoder in the space-filling curve convolutional autoencoder

training: bool¶
class models_FPC.CNN_2(hidden_2)¶

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

The architecture of second subnetwork in hierarchical autoencoder is used in flow past cylinder. It consists of fully connected layers and convolutional layers. We use the space-filling-curve (SFC) to map the multi-dimensional space into the one-dimensional space representation.

Parameters

hidden_2 (int) – The number of the latent variable can be adjusted from 1 to any proper value

forward(x, mode)¶

Send the data to the encoder and decoder in order to get the corresponding output

Parameters

  • x (tensor or numpy) – The input data to the autoencoder

  • mode (numpy) – The output of the encoder in first subnetwork

Returns

  • encoded (tensor) – The output of the encoder in the space-filling curve convolutional autoencoder

  • decoded (tensor) – The output of the decoder in the space-filling curve convolutional autoencoder

training: bool¶
class models_FPC.FC(hidden_1)¶

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

The architecture of SVD autoencoder is used in flow past cylinder. It consists of fully connected layers. We have taken SVD to reduce the nodes from 41100 to 1600 and use this autoencoder to further reduce the variables.

Parameters

hidden_1 (int) – The number of the latent variable can be adjusted from 1 to any proper value

forward(x)¶

Send the data to the encoder and decoder in order to get the corresponding output

Parameters

x (tensor or numpy) – The input data to the autoencoder

Returns

  • encoded (tensor) – The output of the encoder in the SVD autoencoder

  • decoded (tensor) – The output of the decoder in the SVD autoencoder

training: bool¶
models_FPC.weight_init(m)¶

This method is used to initialise the model’s weight and bias. For the linear layer, we will use xavier initialization

Parameters

m (model) – Newly created autoencoder
